title: How to Care for Madagascar Periwinkle

steps.headline: Purchase a plant from the local nursery or garden centre.
steps.description: Alternatively, grow the plant from seed in spring to obtain really good flowering plants. This plant can also be propagated by cuttings.

steps.headline: Use a soil-based compost in the pot.
Place the Madagascar periwinkle in bright light or direct sunlight.
steps.description: A sunny windowsill is ideal or a south-facing room (northern hemisphere) or a north-facing room (southern hemisphere). Avoid growing the plant in conditions under 10ºC.

steps.headline: Water regularly.
steps.description: Don't over-water or water log it though; the soil should be evenly moist and well draining. Mist the foliage regularly if the humidity is below 50 percent and use a pebble tray to stand the plant on.

steps.headline: Feed every 14 days from early spring to autumn (fall).
Consider whether to overwinter it or to treat it as an annual.
steps.description: It's not likely to provide as good a show of flowers the next year that it is grown unless you feed and water it regularly. If keeping, repot it in the spring.

text: Purchase a plant from the local nursery or garden centre. Alternatively, grow the plant from seed in spring to obtain really good flowering plants. This plant can also be propagated by cuttings. Use a soil-based compost in the pot.  Place the Madagascar periwinkle in bright light or direct sunlight. A sunny windowsill is ideal or a south-facing room (northern hemisphere) or a north-facing room (southern hemisphere). Avoid growing the plant in conditions under 10ºC. Water regularly. Don't over-water or water log it though; the soil should be evenly moist and well draining. Mist the foliage regularly if the humidity is below 50 percent and use a pebble tray to stand the plant on. Feed every 14 days from early spring to autumn (fall). Use a general liquid fertiliser. Consider whether to overwinter it or to treat it as an annual. It's not likely to provide as good a show of flowers the next year that it is grown unless you feed and water it regularly. If keeping, repot it in the spring.
